PS398 - Spring 2012
Schedule | HWs
Week Topics
Week 0:
Prep for class 		Work through ”Learn Python the Hard Way, 2nd Ed.”. Email the group about things that don’t make sense. It is not expected that everything will be crystal clear, but figuring out which parts of this are hazy will give us a good starting point and some momentum going into the start of class.
Week 1:
Building Software: Some Best Practices 		Python Review
Source Control: DVC, Git, github
Exceptions in Python
Testing: Motivations, TDD, Unit Testing

Homework 1 - Due next class
Week 2:
Object Oriented Programming 		Object Oriented Concepts: Motivations, Polymorphism, Inheritance, Encapsulation, Static/Instance, Public/Private
How does Python do it?: Python classes, constructors, __str__

Homework 2 - Due next class
Week 3:
Algorithms 		Sort: Merge Sort, Quick Sort, others
Search: Binary Search, Search Trees
Complexity: How is it measured? Big O notation, Brief intro to P/NP
Bonus: Graphing in Python (time permitting, otherwise it is HW)

Homework 3 - Due next class
Week 4:
Algorithms Rd. 2 		Recursion: What is it? When to use it?
Dynamic Programming: What is it? When to use it?

Homework 4 - Due next class
Week 5:
Data Structures 		Common Data Structures: Array, List, Stack, Queue, Tree, Graph, Dictionary
Python’s Data Structures: What does Python have?

Homework 5 - Due next class
Week 6:
I/O 		File I/O: reading and Writing
HTTP: GET/POST
REST: Twitter API
Performance

Homework 6 - Due next class
Week 7:
Databases 		Relational Database Design
Database performance considerations
Using databases with Python

Homework 7 - Due next class
Week 8:
Classification 		Classification algorithms
Naive Bayes
Nearest Neighbor
Neural Networks

Homework 8 - Due next class
Week 9:
Linear Programming 		What is an LP?
What types of problems can we solve?
Applications in MathProg
Applications in Python

Homework 9 - Due next class
Week 10:
Slack / Special Topics
Week 11:
Project Checkins / Code Reviews
Week 12:
Project Checkins / Code Reviews
